The most famous living runes are those of the ancient Runelords of Thassilon, resurging as Thassilon rebuilds in the modern era. Other living runes can be found, however, each with its own particular abilities. Living runes can also be crafted to deal different types of energy damage with their Strikes. **Divine**: Divine living runes are crafted by various churches and sects and typically bear the symbol of a deity, archdevil, or other divine force. Divine living runes replace [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) with [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) and have the following innate spells.
**Divine Innate Spells** DC 35, attack +27; **7th** [_divine decree_](/Spells.aspx?ID=82) (×2); **6th** [_blade barrier_](/Spells.aspx?ID=24), [_glyph of warding_](/Spells.aspx?ID=138) (at will), [_repulsion_](/Spells.aspx?ID=254), [_spirit blast_](/Spells.aspx?ID=301); **5th** [_divine wrath_](/Spells.aspx?ID=86) (×2), [_flame strike_](/Spells.aspx?ID=120) **Occult**: These runes are crafted by unknown hands and often left in out-of-the-way places. Occult living runes replace Arcana with [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) and have the following innate spells.
**Occult Innate Spells** DC 35, attack +27; **7th** [_visions of danger_](/Spells.aspx?ID=358) (×2); **6th** [_feeblemind_](/Spells.aspx?ID=112), [_glyph of warding_](/Spells.aspx?ID=138) (at will), [_phantasmal calamity_](/Spells.aspx?ID=218), [_vibrant pattern_](/Spells.aspx?ID=357); **5th** [_crushing despair_](/Spells.aspx?ID=57) (×2), [_synesthesia_](/Spells.aspx?ID=328) (×2); **Cantrips (7th)** [_detect magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=66); **Constant (6th)** [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) **Primal**: Primal living runes usually resemble animate carvings rather than lines of power or paint, and are often found on menhirs or sacred trees. Primal living runes replace Arcana with [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) and have the following innate spells.
**Primal Innate Spells** DC 35, attack +27; **7th** [_volcanic eruption_](/Spells.aspx?ID=360) (×2); **6th** [_baleful polymorph_](/Spells.aspx?ID=17), [_flesh to stone_](/Spells.aspx?ID=123), [_glyph of warding_](/Spells.aspx?ID=138) (at will), [_tangling creepers_](/Spells.aspx?ID=331); **5th** [_cone of cold_](/Spells.aspx?ID=47) (×2), [_wall of fire_](/Spells.aspx?ID=362) (×2); **1st** [_detect alignment_](/Spells.aspx?ID=65) (at will); **Constant (6th)** [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) **[Recall Knowledge - Construct](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4)): DC 36 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 [Arcane Living Rune](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1222) **Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 163 **Perception** +25; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) **Languages** truescript **Skills** [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +27, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +24, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +25 **Str** +1 **Dex** +6 **Con** +1 **Int** +8 **Wis** +8 **Cha** +5 **Truescript** A living rune can't speak, but it can sculpt its form into complicated scripts and pictographs that can be understood by any creature with the ability to read written language. A living rune can also understand any written or spoken language. --- **AC** 34 **Fort** +20 **Ref** +23 **Will** +27 **HP** 245 **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [diseased](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [doomed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=9), [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10), [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15), [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34), [unconsciousness](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) **Backdrop** When a creature attempts to Strike a living rune and critically misses, the attacker hits the surface (a canvas, wall, or so on) behind the living rune. This might damage the surface or the attacker's weapon, at the GM's discretion.
**Surface-Bound** A living rune can move only along flat surfaces. If the surface it's on is destroyed (such as a portrait hit by a [_fireball_](/Spells.aspx?ID=119) spell or a wall being smashed), the rune takes 7d6 damage and is shunted to the nearest flat surface. If there is no flat surface within 5 feet, the rune is destroyed --- **Speed** 25 feet **Ranged** electrical blast +25 ([Electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 4d12 electricity **Arcane Innate Spells** DC 35, attack +27 - **Cantrips (7th)** [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66) - **5th** [Black Tentacles](/Spells.aspx?ID=23) (×2), [Cloudkill](/Spells.aspx?ID=42) (×2) - **6th** [Chain Lightning](/Spells.aspx?ID=33), [Disintegrate](/Spells.aspx?ID=76), [Glyph of Warding](/Spells.aspx?ID=138) (at will), [Wall of Force](/Spells.aspx?ID=363) - **7th** [Prismatic Spray](/Spells.aspx?ID=233) (×2) - **Constant (6th)** [True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344)
Camouflage Living runes are aware of the value of surprise attacks. They often hide themselves amongst other inscriptions or glyphs, observing foes for a time before striking, though clever adventurers who Investigate the inscriptions might notice the presence of the living rune. Living runes are also fond of setting up [_glyphs of warding_](/Spells.aspx?ID=138) as decoys and dummies.
name: Arcane Living Rune
